title: Man loses 20 stone after being fat-shamed
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Piers Morgan was for once almost lost for words when a previously obese man revealed he lost 20 stone in a year after intentional fat-shaming.

Darren “Dibsy McClintock appeared on Good Morning Britain on Tuesday to reveal how he once weighed 40 stone but was able to shed the pounds with the help of a generous personal trainer – and his favourite local takeaways who agreed with his request to ban him from eating in their restaurants.

Speaking to Piers, Susanna Reid and Charlotte Hawkins, who were all equally as stunned as each other, Dibsy’s personal trainer Mike said: ‘Each year I take one person for free to change their life. I’d never met him before and I’ll be honest, I’d never seen a human being walk in as big as I did that day.

‘It’s a difficult situation because Dibsy had heart condition.

‘His mum broke down in tears and said, “Please, I don’t want to bury my son”. I’ve got three kids, I know how that feels.’

Mike added poignantly: ‘It was life and death.’

When Piers, 54, accused Mike of fat-shaming Dibsy, the fitness worker defended himself and said: ‘I was bullied as a kid, I hate bullies and I think fat-shaming is a form of bullying.’

Dibsy used to weigh 40 stone and consumed 11,000 calories a day (Picture: ITV)

Local takeaways agreed to ban Dibsy (Picture: ITV)

Dibsy later revealed how he consumed 11,000 calories a day eating fast food from his local takeaways.

But after a push from Mike, he agreed to allow the restaurants to put up posters stating they would refuse to serve him food, supporting his weight loss mission.

‘I’d get up in the morning and eat two or three sandwiches with a pint of milk or juice. Then an hour later I’d be having a sandwich again, then McDonald’s and other takeaways, just every two hours I’d eat the wrong things,’ Disby recalled.

Piers was almost speechless for once (Picture: Rex Features)

He also admitted: ‘It was the harsh reality of seeing a picture and realising what I put my mum through. I was selfish.’

With sheer determination, Dibsy was able to lose 20 stone and will undergo operations to tighten loose skin as a result of his weight loss.

Despite congratulating his guest on the incredible achievement, Piers still thought that Dibsy was being ‘fat-shamed’.

‘Whichever way you dress this up, that is a form of fat-shaming. You’re basically saying look at this fat guy, don’t serve him fat food,’ the TV host said.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
